info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 24 at 4:13AM EST until December 24 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches possible, mainly north of Route 28. * WHERE...Northern Herkimer County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon EST today. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes, and could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow should gradually settle southward across northern Herkimer County Sunday morning, affecting areas mainly along and north of Route 28. The lake effect snow should lift back northward late Sunday night or early Monday morning.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
